attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A petition to ban China fur imports got 500+ signatures & this reply:
"national import bans would be less effective than working around the world to agree animal welfare standards & phase out cruel & inhumane farming & trapping practices".

UK government obviously has no power "work around the world" in China, nor force an EU ban (which has a separate petition, but was muddled-in with this reply). Such power is 0% effective.

Banning China to UK fur import is 100% effective in reducing suffering in the case of each animal saved.

The Government should reconsider its belief, compare 100% with 0% and decide which is  greater.

Recap:
"Millions of animals are killed every year in China and the fur trade is growing. The British fashion industry turns over more than £500m a year in animal fur, including cat & dog fur imported from China. These animals are kept in appalling conditions & treated abhorrently (including several reports of animals being skinned whilst still alive)."

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
